--- title: "Directed Acyclic Graphs" author: "Shashidhar Cheeti" number-sections: false --- # Assignment ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_0df7009e8c200bdf14f8569454140644'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load necessary Libraries library(tidyverse) library(dagitty) library(ggdag) library(ggrepel) ``` ::: 1. DAG for Parking Spots ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_f9483318043d935922c5a85897be1489'} ```{.r .cell-code} Parking_Spots <- dagify( Y ~ X, X ~ Z, Y ~ Z, coords = list(x = c(Y = 3, Z = 2, X = 1), y = c(Y = 0, Z = 1, X = 0)), labels = c("X" = "ParkingSpots", "Y" = "Sales", "Z" = "Location") ) ggdag(Parking_Spots, text = TRUE) + geom_dag_point(color = "blue") + geom_dag_text(color = "white") + geom_dag_edges(edge_color = "black") + geom_dag_label_repel(aes(label = label)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: 2. Regression ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_a274852b409e860f568755961b22898b'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load the file customer_sat <- readRDS("Causal_Data_Science_Data/customer_sat.rds") # Create a Data Frame df=data.frame(customer_sat) head(df) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: 2.1 Regress satisfaction on follow_ups ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_a3f169ae1b3a2a02959827547289fd8a'} ```{.r .cell-code} #lm_2_1 is the regresssion of satisfaction on follow_ups lm_2_1 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups , data = df) summary(lm_2_1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = df) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -12.412 -5.257 1.733 4.506 12.588 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 78.8860 4.2717 18.467 1.04e-10 *** #> follow_ups -3.3093 0.6618 -5.001 0.000243 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.658, Adjusted R-squared: 0.6316 #> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF, p-value: 0.0002427 ``` ::: ::: 2.2 Regress satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_e59b8f8d1a8787ec5c50f8d16ef0cc91'} ```{.r .cell-code} #lm_2_2 is the regresssion of satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription lm_2_2 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription , data = df) summary(lm_2_2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = df) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -4.3222 -2.1972 0.3167 2.2667 3.9944 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 26.7667 6.6804 4.007 0.00206 ** #> follow_ups 2.1944 0.7795 2.815 0.01682 * #> subscriptionPremium 44.7222 5.6213 7.956 6.88e-06 *** #> subscriptionPremium+ 18.0722 2.1659 8.344 4.37e-06 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.9597, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9487 #> F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF, p-value: 5.956e-08 ``` ::: ::: 3. Comparing the coefficients: In the first regression with satisfaction on follow_ups are negatively correlated as increase in satisfaction with the product and service will decrease the follow_up calls to the clients. In the second regression with satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription is highly correlated premium subscription levels than elite subscription levels. 4. Plot the data ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_1816b7c617e02fada4dcf34d42c3850f'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Not conditioning on subscription subscription_not_cond <- ggplot(df, aes(x = satisfaction, y = follow_ups)) + geom_point(alpha = .8) + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) # Conditioning on subscription subscription_cond <- ggplot(df, aes(x = satisfaction, y = follow_ups, color = subscription)) + geom_point(alpha = .8) + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) + theme(legend.position = "right") # Plot both plots subscription_not_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} subscription_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-2.png){width=672} ::: :::
